comment: Easiest class. Just 4 exams. Study using the textbook and you will get an A. Lockdown exam but without webcam. No homework, no project and attendance is not mandatory. She also gave us extra credit opportunity which raised my grade up.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I loved this class because I didn't even have to show up and I still got an A. She just reads off the powerpoints which I can easily do on my own. She's very kind though, I had a covid scare and a test was coming up and she offered to give me another day to take it if needed. She cancels class a lot btw. Only 4 tests but you can use notes/ppt.

Nothing special but nothing great. If you know basic US government it should be an easy A. If you dont just use her study guides and lectures slides as that was 99% of the test. She would randomly cancel class so beware of that. Overall average professor.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Cagle was the worst professor I've had yet. She reads word for word off of a power point and constantly adds to it until the test, but only goes over the smallest part of it before she adds more. so you end up having to read the powerpoint at home (which by the way averages on about 70 slides of nonsense).

Average, government teacher. She's pretty clear with everything and communicates fairly well. She posts all her powerpoints on D2L and the tests are based on that and the study guide so not many people attended lectures. Easy to maintain a good grade as long as you remember her weekly Friday assignment.

She is a good professor as she knows what she is talking about. There is a lot of notes. There are four tests and an assignment every Friday. The notes are all straight from the textbook. She also provides a study guide prior to each test. You just need to review the study guide before the test and you should pass it easily.
She breezes through lectures and often sends emails to the wrong classes. She isn't tech savvy. She seems like a nice person, but not a great teacher.

All she does is read from the PowerPoint and the tests are really hard. there are 4 tests but you can exempt the last one if you want. I would not suggest taking her because she also doesn't know how to use technology.

she has had issues this whole semester. Don't bother trying to take notes because she breezes through the power point. She is NOT tech savvy. There has been issues with every online exam we've done so far. My class is only graded on 4 tests but her other has weekly assignments and she keeps mixing our classes up. Easy-ish class, but at what cost?

I have heard from many peers that POLS1101 is difficult, but Cagle makes it so easy. Lectures are non-mandatory and usually only last 30-45 minutes, only one assignment a week (online, no class friday) that takes a max of 5 minutes to complete, and quizzes are rare but easy. Definitely take her for an easy credit if POLS is not your major.

She is sooo chill. The only grades you have in the whole class are 4 tests. The tests are lockdown but no webcam. She sends out a study guide and thats the test. I have never went to a zoom call or taken one note & have got a 88+ on my tests just based off the study guide. She doesnt care if u come to class. Also has extra credit. TAKE THIS CLASS
Sweet, caring, loving professor. Not a hard class at all. 4 exams that are super easy with extra credit given. This class is a must.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: She's very understanding and a great professor. Only 4 tests the whole semester so be ready for them and its an easy A.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Rushed through lectures, let classes out way too early, & cancelled class all the time. Didnt get much learning done in class. Study guides were provide but very tedious, & lots of info on exams that werent on the study guide.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Practically an online class, she posts the notes online and expects that everyone reads them on their own time and rushes through the slides during lectures with brief explanations

Her class is made up of 4 test, YOU HAVE TO READ THE BOOK or pay attention to lectures or you will not pass. She does give one extra credit assignment but that still didn't help a person who failed the first 2 exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She posts her notes online so she breezes through the slides before you can write stuff down. Shes nice. She wants students to participate and the subject is more fun when youre willing to participate and listen to them. Phones are a no go. She will stop her entire lecture to make sure you get off your phone.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor was interesting. She counted the bonus questions on our tests against us and argued when we tried to get her to fix it. She finally did after the second to last class. Two of our tests were open notes and they were still very tough tests. She didn't seem to know what she wanted to teach and would get confused during the power points.

Her tests are pretty difficult. 2 out of 4 of our tests were open note. Tests consist of true/false, multiple choice, fill in the blank, and 2 short answer. Her study guides are helpful but the tests are difficult for an 1101 class. It would be difficult to get an A. She is very sweet but this class definitely requires a lot of effort even for a B.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Her class was easy, She just gives 4 tests (final isn't cumulative). She sometimes makes tests open notes and provides a study guide for each test, Study everything on the study guide and u'll do just fine. She only took attendance on the class before the test. She always lets us out about 30 minutes early. She's pretty nice & loves participation
She was a great professor. Make sure you do the study guide because that will help with the test

she's an amazing teacher! she's smart and very laid back. she really tries to help students pass the class and i love her discussions in class. tests were a bit hard but she managed to give us open book tests a few times. very sweet professor too, i honestly enjoyed her class from beginning to end.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Amazing teacher, really knows what she's talking about. A bit older, so doesn't necessarily work well with youtube videos etc. Great in class discussions, but the only grades are the 4 tests. she made 3 of ours open notes so they weren't difficult but I don't know what I would've done otherwise.

The lectures were absolutely horrible! She made fun of students and makes you feel so stupid. She is not caring at all and does not round grades. Also, her tests are extremely hard and her study guides are ridiculous. If you take her, don't go to class, just get the book and read it yourself.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Seemed to not really understand her own lectures. Did not appear like she wanted to be there. Tests are harder than you would expect, given that her class lectures are so poor.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She talks very fast. By the time you look up she's on the next slide. I recommend getting the book for the class, cause the powerpoints are just bullet points of what she's going to talk about. 4 tests, no homework. Will dismiss you for being on your phone. Students using laptops must sit in the 1st 2 rows. Not that bad. Always lets us out earlyy

I would not take her class if I could help it. My biggest problem is that the whole grade book is made up of 4 tests and extra credit for 3 points. She talks very fast which makes it hard to take notes and  she has another job that takes priority over teaching. she lets out 15 - 30 minutes before class ends and is willing to listen to you
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is a funny professor and always lets you out 15-30 minutes early. However, she talks fast so you can't get all the notes down and her tests are pretty difficult. There is one extra credit assignment for 3 extra points. I wouldn't take her again.

She is very helpful to students. She gives out study guides before test so that you are informed on what is on the test and her power points are very detailed. This class in not an easy A but you could get an A just by paying attention and taking notes. I dislike Political Science but this professor made it interesting and fun to learn.
